problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Link box assignment with position assignment
        assert assignments[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                # Not overlapping if one is to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or
                    assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x or
                    assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure each item is assigned to exactly one box and its position is consistent
        assert x_y_positions[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]

ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Objects ---
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 52, "height": 98}, {"width": 11, "height": 35}, {"width": 94, "height": 65}, {"width": 47, "height": 72}, {"width": 92, "height": 12}, {"width": 11, "height": 39}, {"width": 90, "height": 35}, {"width": 53, "height": 69}, {"width": 35, "height": 37}, {"width": 24, "height": 68}, {"width": 92, "height": 16}, {"width": 71, "height": 91}, {"width": 44, "height": 82}, {"width": 98, "height": 81}, {"width": 52, "height": 58}, {"width": 2, "height": 82}, {"width": 63, "height": 72}, {"width": 83, "height": 70}, {"width": 78, "height": 63}, {"width": 43, "height": 19}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

def place_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_height: int,
    box_width: int
):
    # Ensure items fit within box dimensions
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        pos: BoxAssignment = x_y_positions[i]
        
        # Position must be within box bounds
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0
        assert pos.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert pos.y + item.height <= box_height
        
        # Box ID must be valid
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 20

    # Ensure each item is assigned to exactly one box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        # Verify box_id is a valid index
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 20

    # Ensure positions are properly assigned
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        pos: BoxAssignment = x_y_positions[i]
        # Check that x and y are within box limits
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0
        assert pos.x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert pos.y + items[i].height <= box_height

place_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, BOX_HEIGHT, BOX_WIDTH)

Item = DSRecord({

    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})

BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 52, "height": 98}, {"width": 11, "height": 35}, {"width": 94, "height": 65}, {"width": 47, "height": 72}, {"width": 92, "height": 12}, {"width": 11, "height": 39}, {"width": 90, "height": 35}, {"width": 53, "height": 69}, {"width": 35, "height": 37}, {"width": 24, "height": 68}, {"width": 92, "height": 16}, {"width": 71, "height": 91}, {"width": 44, "height": 82}, {"width": 98, "height": 81}, {"width": 52, "height": 58}, {"width": 2, "height": 82}, {"width": 63, "height": 72}, {"width": 83, "height": 70}, {"width": 78, "height": 63}, {"width": 43, "height": 19}]

x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure coordinates are non-negative
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        # Link box assignments with positions
        assert assignments[i].box_id == positions[i].box_id
        assert assignments[i].x == positions[i].x
        assert assignments[i].y == positions[i].y

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if positions[i].box_id == positions[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# Ensure all redundant fields between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if positions[i].box_id == positions[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis

                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# Ensure all redundant fields between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_in_box_fit_exactly(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        pos : Position = positions[i]
        box_id : int = assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure item is placed within the box boundaries
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

items_in_box_fit_exactly(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def no_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles overlap
                # They don't overlap if one is to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    # Each item is assigned to exactly one box (this is implicitly ensured by the domain of assignments)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(item_box_assignments)

# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({

})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box

    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})

ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 52, "height": 98}, {"width": 11, "height": 35}, {"width": 94, "height": 65}, {"width": 47, "height": 72}, {"width": 92, "height": 12}, {"width": 11, "height": 39}, {"width": 90, "height": 35}, {"width": 53, "height": 69}, {"width": 35, "height": 37}, {"width": 24, "height": 68}, {"width": 92, "height": 16}, {"width": 71, "height": 91}, {"width": 44, "height": 82}, {"width": 98, "height": 81}, {"width": 52, "height": 58}, {"width": 2, "height": 82}, {"width": 63, "height": 72}, {"width": 83, "height": 70}, {"width": 78, "height": 63}, {"width": 43, "height": 19}]

nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)

    for i in range(2, N_ITEMS + 1):

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.
